Package Model

Class DeckManager

java.lang.Object
Model.DeckManager
public class DeckManager extends Object
Class used to manage a deck of cards of a Uno Game.
Deck is composed basing on a card distribution, each Value is associated with the number of instances for each Color.
Author:
D'annibale Luigi, Venturini Daniele
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • deck

      private Stack<Card> deck

    • discards

      private Stack<Card> discards

    • CLASSIC_RULES_CARD_DISTRIBUTION

      public static final HashMap<Value,Integer> CLASSIC_RULES_CARD_DISTRIBUTION
      Classic card distrbution of Uno
      108 cards distributed so:
      • 4 Cards Wild
      • 4 Cards Wild Draw
      • Then for each color:
        • 1 Zero Card
        • 2 Cards for each value from 1 to 9
        • 2 Cards draw
        • 2 Cards skip
        • 2 Cards reverse

  • Constructor Details

    • DeckManager

      public DeckManager()
      Creates a DeckManager with a deck with classic Uno cards distribution

    • DeckManager

      public DeckManager(HashMap<Value,Integer> numberOfCards) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Parameters:
      numberOfCards - : it is an HashMap that maps a Value to an integer.
      For each card value must be specified the corresponding number of cards that have to assume that value.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - : If the size of the numerOfCards is not 15.

    • addManyCards

      private void addManyCards(Color color, Value value, int numberOfCards)
      Actually adds more instances of a card to the deck
      Parameters:
      color - : the Color of the Card
      value - : the Value of the Card
      numberOfCards - : how many instances of the card have to be added
